queue

Class ExecutionEngine<T extends java.io.Serializable>

  • java.lang.Object
    • queue.ExecutionEngine<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of elements held in this queue that implements the Serializable interface.

    public class ExecutionEngine<T extends java.io.Serializable>
extends java.lang.Object
    ExecutionEngine is an entry in this process. When any code point needs some queue operation, can be used this Queue Execution Engine. This has synchronized queue, user can put the Serializable custom bean to the queue and specify the time delay for the queue element execution cycle. Executor interface is given to implement the user own execute method.

    Examples of expected usage: 

    
  //Create an ExecutionEngine and start.
  boolean isAutoStart = false ;
  boolean isAutoRestart = false ;
  //Time Delay in Millisecond
  int timeDelay = 100 ;
  int queueLength - 100 ;

  //ExecutorImpl is an implementation of the Executor to do the task when the executor do execute.
  Executor executor = new ExecutorImpl();
  ExecutionEngine executionEngine =  new ExecutionEngine(executor,isAutoStart,
                                                                                                                        isAutoRestart,timeDelay,queueLength);
  executionEngine.startEngine();

  //Put an element to the queue
  CustomBean customBean = new CustomBean();
  executionEngine.getSynchQueue().put(customBean);

    • Constructor Detail

      • ExecutionEngine

        public ExecutionEngine(Executor<T> executor,
               boolean isAutoStart,
               boolean isAutoRestart,
               long callDelay,
               int queueLength)
                throws QueueException
        Parameters:
        executor - is an interface that wants to implement to get the call for execute.
        isAutoStart - is true then server will be stated when create an instance of ExecutionEngine.
        callDelay - is the time delay in between the poll of queue.
        queueLength - is maximum number of elements that can held by the queue.
        Throws:
        QueueException
